div1.p: We were all very happy to get your letter and hear about your wonderful experience in Kansas City, and your luxurious flight to Lincoln.
You finally received a draft from the First Bank of Commerce which was sent through Lloyds Bank Ltd. of London. I am enclosing the check herewith.

Let me know if you want to write them about the difference resulting from the depreciation of the pound. If you do not to accept this check, send it back to me. I think it is unfair in a way, but the final agreement wasn't signed until after devaluation of the pound. Of course, this delay was not your fault. Let me know what you want to do.
We all miss you very much, although we are happy to have you there with the Youngs and exceedingly happy that you are writing again.

Today is a lovely, sunny day, and we are beginning to think about Spring a little bit. It makes us want to get out and run and skip and play. Unfortunately, I am afraid that I am going to have to work very hard. One of these weekends, we three in the "Sorority House" may jump our little car and drive up and see you . How would that be?
Much love to you and the Youngs from all of us.
